topic.title: Junk Folder
topic.p: The Junk folder is a system folder that receives unsolicited email messages from SpamAssassin; this folder cannot be renamed or deleted.

You should regularly check the contents of the Junk folder before clearing it. Mail filtering is not a perfect science; you might find that some messages you wanted to receive have been filtered to the Junk folder.

ol.title: To clear the Junk folder:

li.p: In the Folder Management menu group, click Folder List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary).

ol.li: Click clear for the Junk folder. A message appears informing you that the Junk folder has been cleared. The system moves the messages to the Trash folder.

ol.title: To recover messages that are in the Junk folder:

li.p: In the Folder Management menu group, click Folder List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary).

ol.li: Click Junk. The Junk folder's content appears.

Select the check boxes for the messages you want to keep and move to another folder (or select the top check box to select all messages).
Note: If the Junk folder contains more than one page of messages, only the currently displayed messages are checked when the top check box is selected.
In the Move Message to drop-down list, select the folder where you want to move the messages.
Click Move. A message appears informing you that the messages have been moved.
